document_title: Coronary artery disease: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: benh-mach-vanh.json_7_Are young people at risk of coronary artery disease?
subsection_content:
Although the disease mainly occurs in older people, in recent years an increasing number of younger people (especially those aged 40-45) have been diagnosed with the disease. The main causes are overweight and obesity, sedentary lifestyle, lack of education/diet and smoking in young people.
Another reason is that most young people think that coronary artery disease only occurs in older people. Therefore, they do not pay attention to the risk factors of the disease, do not screen and detect the disease early, making the treatment effectiveness not high.
Cardiovascular Center of Tam Anh General Hospital system owns a system of machinery imported from abroad and a team of leading physicians in the field of cardiology, which is the place to perform examination, screening and treatment for patients. suffering from cardiovascular disease such as coronary artery disease, myocardial infarction, heart failure, stenosis/regurgitation of heart valves...
The Center has close coordination with other specialties such as Testing Center, Diagnostic Imaging Center, Obstetrics and Gynecology, General Surgery, General Internal Medicine (Respiratory, Hematology, Gastroenterology...), Ear, Nose and Throat, Maxillofacial, Urology and Nephrology... help accurately diagnose diseases and provide appropriate treatment regimens for patients.
Coronary heart disease in particular and cardiovascular diseases in general  can be prevented through healthy living and good nutrition. Regular cardiovascular health checks will also help you detect early signs of disease and have timely treatment plans.
